title: The Hawaiian story of the wind keepers - Sydney Iaukea

multiple-choice.question: Who is the Hawaiian wind goddess that Paka'a inherits his ability to control the winds from?
Why does Paka'a become the target of jealousy and betrayal from two of the king's seafaring navigators?

options.label: A
options.text: He is too skilled at controlling the winds.

options.label: B
options.text: He is too loyal to the king.

options.label: C
options.text: He is too rich and privileged.

options.label: D
options.text: He is too young and inexperienced.

multiple-choice.question: Where does Paka'a take refuge after being exiled by the king?
Who is Kuapaka'a determined to avenge and restore to his rightful place beside the king?
How does Kuapaka'a earn the king's trust?

options.label: B
options.text: By unleashing a storm and forcing the king's fleet to shelter on Moloka'i.

options.label: C
options.text: By winning a canoe race against the eight fishermen appointed by the treacherous navigators.

options.label: D
options.text: By wagering his bones against the fishermen's.

multiple-choice.question: What does the king ask Kuapaka'a to do after Kuapaka'a wins the canoe race against the eight fishermen?

options.label: A
options.text: To have mercy on the fishermen.

options.label: C
options.text: To join the king's search for Paka'a.

options.label: D
options.text: To become the king's new attendant.

multiple-choice.question: Why does the king agree to the deaths of the eight fishermen appointed by the treacherous navigators?

options.label: A
options.text: Because he is angry with them.

options.label: B
options.text: Because he is afraid of Kuapaka'a.

options.label: C
options.text: Because he wants to prove his commitment to Paka'a.

options.label: D
options.text: Because he wants to punish them for their betrayal.

multiple-choice.question: What does Paka'a and Kuapaka'a ensure will never be lost?
